questions.question: A solution with a pH of 2 has how many more hydrogen ions in it than a solution with a pH of 4?
In a single molecule of water, two hydrogen atoms are bonded to a single oxygen atom by ____.
Of the following pH values, which indicates the most basic pH?
Consider two solutions: solution X has a pH of 4; solution Y has a pH of 7. From this information, we can reasonably conclude that ____.
possible_answers: the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution X is 1000 times as great as the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution Y
the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution Y is 1000 times as great as the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution X
solution Y has no free hydrogen ions (H+)
the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution X is 3 times as great as the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution Y
questions.correct_answer: the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution X is 1000 times as great as the concentration of hydrogen ions in solution Y

questions.question: The atoms in water molecules are held together by hydrogen bonds.
Based on your knowledge of the polarity of water molecules, the solute molecule depicted is most likely ____.
A chemist adds a chemical to pure water and there is a 100-fold increase in the concentration of hydrogen ions. What is the best approximation of the new pH value?
Cohesion, surface tension, and adhesion are the properties of water molecules that ____.
possible_answers: are a result of hydrogen bonding
are a result of polar covalent bonding
questions.correct_answer: are a result of hydrogen bonding

questions.question: The cities of Portland, Oregon, and Minneapolis, Minnesota, are at about the same latitude, but Minneapolis has much hotter summers and much colder winters than Portland. Why?
possible_answers: The ocean near Portland moderates the temperature.
Fresh water is more likely to freeze than salt water.
Minneapolis is much windier, due to its location in the middle of North America.
They are not at the same exact latitude.
questions.correct_answer: The ocean near Portland moderates the temperature.

questions.question: Low humidity in the atmosphere on a hot day ____.
possible_answers: helps in cooling because water evaporates from the skin faster
does not help in cooling because water evaporates from the skin faster
helps in cooling because skin absorbs water from the atmosphere
does not help in cooling because skin absorbs water from the atmosphere
questions.correct_answer: helps in cooling because water evaporates from the skin faster

questions.question: The partial negative charge at one end of a water molecule is attracted to the partial positive charge of another water molecule. What is this attraction called?
Water molecules can form hydrogen bonds with ____.
possible_answers: compounds that have polar covalent bonds
questions.correct_answer: compounds that have polar covalent bonds

questions.question: A solution with a pH of 7 is neither acidic nor basic.
If the cytoplasm of a cell is at pH 7, and the mitochondrial matrix is at pH 8, then the concentration of H+ ions ____.
possible_answers: is 10 times higher in the cytoplasm than in the mitochondrial matrix
is 10 times higher in the mitochondrial matrix than in the cytoplasm
in the cytoplasm is 7/8 the concentration in the mitochondrial matrix
in the cytoplasm is 8/7 the concentration in the mitochondrial matrix
questions.correct_answer: is 10 times higher in the cytoplasm than in the mitochondrial matrix

questions.question: The high heat of vaporization of water helps you feel cooler when you sweat because the transition of water from a liquid to a gas requires a ____ of energy to break hydrogen bonds. The energy is ____ from heat produced by your body.
